name: Terry Winograd
background: Professor Emeritus of Computer Science at Stanford University. Creator of SHRDLU (1968-70), pioneering natural language understanding system. Co-author of *Understanding Computers and Cognition* (1986) with Fernando Flores, applying phenomenology to HCI. Pioneer in human-computer interaction, language/action perspective, and design thinking. Advised Google founders, founded Stanford HCI Group.

principles.name: Critique of Cognitivism
principles.description: Intelligence arises from situated, embodied interaction, not disembodied symbol manipulation. Influenced HCI, groupware, ethical computing.
principles.falsification: When critique of cognitivism leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Human-Centered Design and HCI
principles.description: Shift from symbolic AI to phenomenological, embodied understanding. Design thinking emphasizes user context, ethics, social responsibility over pure computation.
principles.falsification: When human-centered design and hci leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Language/Action Perspective
principles.description: Communication is a sequence of commitments and actions (with Flores). Software design for collaborative work should model conversation-for-action rather than information transfer.
principles.falsification: When language/action perspective leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Situated Language Understanding (SHRDLU)
principles.description: Language comprehension requires grounding in physical or simulated context, integrating semantics, memory, physics simulation, and procedural knowledge. SHRDLU demonstrated natural language interaction in blocks world.
principles.falsification: When situated language understanding (shrdlu) leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
